page.title: 12OVER WYRESDALE:CHURCH LIFE
page.content: Although the church is not in any village it is quite well attended, possibly because of a succession of vicars who cared. The present vicar, the Rev.Titterington was licensed in July, 1985 for a period of two years. The parishioners have chosen to subsidize his stipend.It is the wish of the Parish Church Council that burial plots should be free to all members of the parish. One service is held each Sunday - at 10.30 a.m. The organist, aged 86, has played for the church for the past 40 years. Recently a non-denominational Women's Guild was formed and the Sunday School is to be restarted. The monthly Parish Magazine is a valuable source of information for the community, announcing births, marriages and deaths, and bulletins of the sick, as well as ecclesiastical news and forthcoming events.
